item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Down the winding cavern we groped our tedious way, till a void boundless as the nether sky appeared beneath us, and we held by the roots of trees and hung over this immensity; but I said: if you please we will commit ourselves to this void and see whether providence is here also." -- William Blake

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We are all subject to the fates. But we must all act as if we are not, or die of despair...death will sweep through all the worlds; it will be the triumph of despair, forever. The universes will all become nothing more than interlocking machines, blind and empty of thought, feeling, life..." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "I was never young. This idea of fun: cars, girls, saturday night, bottle of wine... to me, these things are morbid. I was always attracted to people with the same problems as me. It doesn't help when most of them are dead." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Friedrich Neitzsche
item.description: "Every deep thinker is more afraid of being understood than of being misunderstood." -- Friedrich Neitzsche

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "We can never know what to want, because, living only one life, we can neither compare it with our previous lives nor perfect it in our lives to come." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Faith: not wanting to know what the truth is." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "When I'm lying in my bed I think about life and I think about death and neither one particularly appeals to me." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "There's more to life than books, you know. But not much more." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
item.description: "History in general is therefore the development of Spirit in Time, as Nature is the development of the Idea is Space." -- Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Katherine Dunn
item.description: "The truth is always an insult or a joke, lies are generally tastier. We love them. The nature of lies is to please. Truth has no concern for anyone's comfort" -- Katherine Dunn

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "You're not right in the head, and nor am I, and this is why....this is why I like you." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "To me you are a work of art, and I would give you my heart - that's if I had one." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "I am the son and the heir of a shyness that is criminally vulgar." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "Age shouldn't affect you. It's just like the size of your shoes - they don't determine how you live your life! You're either marvellous or you're boring, regardless of your age." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "I was happy in the haze of a drunken hour, but heaven knows I'm miserable now." -- Morrissey

item.title: Fearlessweaver add a quote by Steven Morrissey
item.description: "Artists aren't really people. And I'm actually 40 per cent papier mache." -- Steven Morrissey
